sn27.10:4.2: “Mendicants, desire and greed for form, feeling, perception, choices,
sn27.10:4.3: or consciousness is a corruption of the mind.
sn27.10:4.4: When a mendicant has given up mental corruption in these five cases, their mind inclines to renunciation.
sn27.10:4.5: A mind imbued with renunciation is declared to be capable of directly knowing anything that can be realized.”
sn27.10:8.1: The Linked Discourses on corruptions are complete.
